## Intent interface

Intents represent the request of a user.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface Intent extends Localizable<LocaleSpecificIntent> 
```
<b>Extends:</b> [Localizable](./stentor-models.localizable.md)<!-- -->&lt;[LocaleSpecificIntent](./stentor-models.localespecificintent.md)<!-- -->&gt;

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [appId](./stentor-models.intent.appid.md) | string | The ID for the app the intent belongs to. |
|  [contexts?](./stentor-models.intent.contexts.md) | { name: string; }\[\] | <i>(Optional)</i> Contexts the must be active to have this intent be weighted more heavily or selected.<!-- -->For Amazon Lex, the contexts are required to be selected.[https://docs.aws.amazon.com/lex/latest/dg/API\_PutIntent.html\#lex-PutIntent-request-inputContexts](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/lex/latest/dg/API_PutIntent.html#lex-PutIntent-request-inputContexts)<!-- -->For Dialogflow ES, these are more heavily weighted towards matching.[https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/es/docs/contexts-input-output\#input\_contexts](https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/es/docs/contexts-input-output#input_contexts) [https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/es/docs/reference/rest/v2/projects.agent.intents\#Intent](https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/es/docs/reference/rest/v2/projects.agent.intents#Intent) |
|  [createdAt?](./stentor-models.intent.createdat.md) | string | <i>(Optional)</i> ISO-8601 string of when the intent was created. |
|  [defaultLocale?](./stentor-models.intent.defaultlocale.md) | [Locale](./stentor-models.locale.md) | <i>(Optional)</i> This is the locale in which the app is primarily focused on. The intent will publish to this locale with the data provided. Items which can be overwritten can be placed in the "locale" section with the locale necessary. |
|  [dialogflowId?](./stentor-models.intent.dialogflowid.md) | string | <i>(Optional)</i> Dialogflow keeps track of individual intents by a unique ID. |
|  [graphCoords?](./stentor-models.intent.graphcoords.md) | [GraphCoords](./stentor-models.graphcoords.md) | <i>(Optional)</i> UI position coordinates for graphing. |
|  [intentId](./stentor-models.intent.intentid.md) | string | The ID of the intent, typically a combination of the name and a random string. |
|  [langCode?](./stentor-models.intent.langcode.md) | [LangCode](./stentor-models.langcode.md) | <i>(Optional)</i> The language code. Defaults to "en-US". |
|  [locales?](./stentor-models.intent.locales.md) | Partial&lt;Record&lt;[Locale](./stentor-models.locale.md)<!-- -->, [LocaleSpecificIntent](./stentor-models.localespecificintent.md)<!-- -->&gt;&gt; | <i>(Optional)</i> This is a series of locales that the apps supports. These can override the items that are in the original Intent. The items in the main intent are used as defaults if they are not provided by this locale.<!-- -->Locales are hierarchical. Languages will override the default attributes. Dialects will override the languages. |
|  [name?](./stentor-models.intent.name.md) | string | <i>(Optional)</i> The human readable name of the intent. |
|  [nlu?](./stentor-models.intent.nlu.md) | { \[nlu: string\]: { type: string; }; } | <i>(Optional)</i> NLU specific metadata used when translating the intentId to a NLU specific type.<!-- -->Use to override the type for a specific NLU. |
|  [organizationId](./stentor-models.intent.organizationid.md) | string | The organization ID for the app of which this intent belongs. |
|  [slots?](./stentor-models.intent.slots.md) | [Slot](./stentor-models.slot.md)<!-- -->\[\] | <i>(Optional)</i> The slots defined within the utterance patterns and their Entity types. |
|  [slotTypes?](./stentor-models.intent.slottypes.md) | [SlotTypeMap](./stentor-models.slottypemap.md) | <i>(Optional)</i> A map of the slot type definition. |
|  [substitutions?](./stentor-models.intent.substitutions.md) | { \[pattern: string\]: string; } | <i>(Optional)</i> Substitutions can be used to clean up your utterance pattern to make it more readable.<!-- -->For example, you may often have a lot of slots at the beginning of every pattern:<code>\{$\{acknowledge\}&#124;$\{yes_no\}&#124;\}$\{prefix\} the rest of the utterance</code>This then moves the actual meat of the pattern to the right when really you don't care about the above except that it is there.<!-- -->Substitutions will allow you to replace these, just at the local intent level, to make it easier to read.<!-- -->{ \["\_PREFIX\_"\]<!-- -->}<!-- -->: "<!-- -->{<!-- -->$<!-- -->{<!-- -->acknowledge<!-- -->}<!-- -->\|$<!-- -->{<!-- -->yes\_no<!-- -->}<!-- -->\|<!-- -->}<!-- -->$<!-- -->{<!-- -->prefix<!-- -->}<!-- -->" }<!-- -->So it then becomes:<code>$\{_PREFIX_\} the rest of the utterance</code>It also allows you to change the substitution value and have it updated across all the utterance patterns where the substitution exists.<!-- -->When compiling the patterns, the substitution is applied first before expanding. |
|  [utterancePatterns?](./stentor-models.intent.utterancepatterns.md) | string\[\] | <i>(Optional)</i> An array of utterance patterns.<!-- -->For more information on syntax see [https://github.com/alexa-js/alexa-utterances](https://github.com/alexa-js/alexa-utterances) |
